game

Class MediumGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Screen
      • game.LevelScreen
        • game.MediumGame

  • public class MediumGame
extends LevelScreen
    The MediumGame class represents the screen for the medium level. It involves acid-base neutralization. The player can shoot either alkali metals or ions at the targets. When a player successfully creates a base, it is added to the end of the inventory. The player wins once all obstacles and targets are cleared.
    Version:
    1.0, May 28 2014. (alkali metals and hydroxide elements update - repeat of EasyGame), 1.1, May 30 2014. (Added code to create and update acid cloud obstacles.), 1.2, May 31 2014 (Creates all inventory, and only displays first 12. No alkaline metals yet.), 1.3, June 2 2014. (JavaDoc), 1.4, June 3 2014. (Modifications due to location class constructor change, removes instead of sets location to null, two keys at once), 1.5, June 4 2014. (Added win and lose screens, can go to difficult level. Added base particles, no functionality.), 1.6, June 4 2014. (Base implementation and having mix and match for alkali and hydroxide, more targets and inventory), 1.7, June 5 2014. (Equal number of hydroxide and alkali metals, JavaDoc partially), 1.8, June 8 2014. (More KISS), 2.0, June 8 2014. (Displays facts.), 2.1, June 10 2014. (JavaDoc)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu, Chusa Nguyen

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediumGame

        public MediumGame(ScreenFactory screenFactory)
        Constructs a medium level screen. This creates a random list of targets and inventory. Acid clouds are also created in the last two rows of targets.
        Parameters:
        screenFactory - - ScreenFactory - The ScreenFactory object that stores the current screen.
        newTargets - - ArrayList - Stores the temporary targets.
        newInventory - - Stores the temporary inventory.
        name - - String - Stores the temporary names of the elements.
        count - - int - Stores the number of hydroxide ions.
        count2 - - int - Stores the number of alkali ions.
        which - - double - Stores whether to add an alkali ion or a hydroxide ion.
        row - - int - For loop counter which stores the current row of the location to set for the elements.
        col - - int - For loop counter which stores the current column of the location to set for the elements.
        element - - int - Stores the temporary index of the current element.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Empty override from the Screen class.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class LevelScreen

      • onUpdate

        public void onUpdate()
        Updates the elements currently stored in the medium level. It first updates the obstacles. Then, the player and shooting is updated. Obstacle-inventory and target-inventory interaction is updated. If there is an obstacle in the same location as the inventory particle, either the inventory is removed, or both the inventory and obstacle. The obstacle is only removed when the inventory is a base. If there is any target directly infront of an inventory particle, either both are removed or only one is removed, depending on whether the user shot at the correct target. Points are also updated. Finally, all elements with no locations are removed, and all elements are updated.
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        index - - int - Stores the index of the target at the same location as the current inventory element.
        index2 - - int - Stores the index of the obstacle at the same location as the current inventory element.
        inv - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary inventory elements.
        tar - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary target elements.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.

      • getObstacleIndex

        public int getObstacleIndex(Location location)
        Returns the obstacle at the location in the parameter. It returns null if not found.
        Parameters:
        location - - Location - The location of the obstacle to find.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
        Returns:
        An int that represents the index of the obstacle, or -1 if it cannot be found.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(java.awt.Graphics2D twoDimensional)
        Displays the medium level on the JPanel. It draws the wallpaper, player (launcher), inventory, targets and obstacles, respectively.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        twoDimensional - - Graphics2D - The Graphics2D object.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
